title: Spack chooses compiler at random if several spec differ only by suffix
body:
I have few gcc@9.2.0 compilers with different features enabled in my compilers.yaml with nicknames (using `spec` field in yaml) like `9.2.0-broadwell-nvptx`, `9.2.0-thunderx2`, `9.2.0-skylake_avx512`, etc. to be able to refer to them specifically. I also have the `9.2.0` which is just generic compiler with no special settings. However when I refer to them via `9.2.0-suffix`, the version suffixes are silently ignored by Spack, and Spack sometimes chooses to use 9.2.0-suffix, and sometimes 9.2.0.

I learned of it by accident, because `lib/spack/llnl/util/cpu/microarchitecture.py` machinery fails to match a the compiler that has suffix in a version, i.e. when the requirement doesn't say anything about suffix, Spack assumes that required suffix is no suffix. (This in and of itself I'd like to report as a bug as well, but I'm not sure if that's the right thing to do yet. First I'd like to get a hang of the situation I describe here.) The condition in said file says:

```python3
            # If the suffixes are not all equal there's no match
            if ((suffix != min_suffix and min_version) or
                (suffix != max_suffix and max_version)):
                return False
```

But like I say, whether this is an issue I'm not sure - however it helped me catch the issue I described, that Spack sometimes chooses to use 9.2.0-suffix, and sometimes 9.2.0. Example output is shown below.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Configure 2 compilers with the same high version differing only by version suffix e.g. `9.2.0` and `9.2.0-skylake_avx512`.
2. Run the same command which requires a certain compiler version (e.g. `target=skylake_avx512` requires gcc >= 6) many times in sequence.
3. Observe that the results are inconsistent. In the output below, I added some debug print()s just before the check above, to print what is the version which Spack is checking the requirement against. And, lo and behold, that version changes randomly...

```console
$ mateusz@warsaw:~$ spack spec -IL bash%gcc@9.2.0-skylake_avx512 target=skylake_avx512
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   bash%gcc@9.2.0-skylake_avx512 arch=linux-None-skylake_avx512

Concretized
--------------------------------
gcc 9.2.0-skylake_avx512
[{'name': 'skylake-avx512', 'versions': '6.0:', 'flags': '-march={name} -mtune={name}'}]
min_suffix: 
version: 9.2.0-skylake_avx512
version+suffix: 9.2.0 skylake_avx512
==> Error: cannot produce optimized binary for micro-architecture 'skylake_avx512' with gcc@9.2.0-skylake_avx512 [supported compiler versions are 6.0:]
mateusz@warsaw:~$ spack spec -IL bash%gcc@9.2.0-skylake_avx512 target=skylake_avx512
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   bash%gcc@9.2.0-skylake_avx512 arch=linux-None-skylake_avx512

Concretized

gcc 9.2.0

min_suffix:
```
